alert.note: Alert for Goliad; Victoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 2:39PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Victoria and northeastern Goliad Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 239 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Schroeder, or 13 miles west of Victoria, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fannin, Mission Valley, Schroeder, Coleto Creek Park and Oak Village. This includes the following highways... US Highway 183 near mile marker 636. US Highway 59 between mile markers 645 and 658. US Highway 77 between mile markers 582 and 584. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
